CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When the PSC devices were fabricated with an inverted architecture ( ITO / ZnO / polymer : PC71BM / MoO 3 / Ag ) in order to further improve the photovoltaic performance , the PCEs of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP - based devices were improved to 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph:

1. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
2. ZnO (Zinc Oxide)
3. PC71BM (a type of polymer)
4. MoO3 (Molybdenum Oxide)
5. Ag (Silver)
6. PTATDPP (a type of polymer)
7. PTAFDPP (a type of polymer)

There are seven material names in total.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the updated "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph:

1. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
2. ZnO (Zinc Oxide)
3. PC71BM (a type of polymer)
4. MoO3 (Molybdenum Oxide)
5. Ag (Silver)

These are the five materials that are clearly mentioned as part of the device architecture. The other two polymers, PTATDPP and PTAFDPP, are not explicitly mentioned as materials, but rather as the basis for the devices being compared. Therefore, they are not included in the list of material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO (Indium Tin Oxide) |
| ZnO (Zinc Oxide) |
| PC71BM (a type of polymer) |
| MoO3 (Molybdenum Oxide) |
| Ag (Silver) |

Note that I've kept the parentheses and the phrase "a type of polymer" in the third entry to match the original wording in the paragraph.

Paragraph: When the PSC devices were fabricated with an inverted architecture ( ITO / ZnO / polymer : PC71BM / MoO 3 / Ag ) in order to further improve the photovoltaic performance , the PCEs of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP - based devices were improved to 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

2. PTATDPP (Polymer-based Thermally Activated Delayed Fluorescence Perylene Diimide)
3. PTAFDPP (Polymer-based Thermally Activated Delayed Fluorescence Perylene Diimide with Fluorine-containing Side Chain)

5. ZnO (Zinc Oxide)
6. PC71BM (Poly[3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl]-alt-[2,5-bis(3-hexylthiophen-2-yl)thieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione])
7. MoO3 (Molybdenum Trioxide)
8. Ag (Silver)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

4. MoO3 (Molybdenum Trioxide)
5. Ag (Silver)

Let's think step by step.

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. 7.02%
2. 5.22%

These are the values of the photovoltaic performance (PCEs) of the PTATDPP and PTAFDPP-based devices, respectively, after the fabrication of the PSC devices with an inverted architecture.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of a material property:

2. 5.22%

These are the values of the photovoltaic performance (PCEs) of the PTATDPP and PTAFDPP-based devices, respectively, which are material properties.
